hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'Indeed, its punishment will be a lasting punishment' (Surah Al-Furqan, verse 65), al-Hasan said: 'Al-Gharam means the lasting punishment that does not depart from its sufferer ever, and any punishment that departs from its sufferer is not considered gharam.'

chainIssues: Chain is maqtu' (cut off at Tabi'i level, not reaching the Prophet ﷺ)
First narrator Muhammad ibn al-Husayn is majhul (unknown)
Second narrator Ibrahim ibn Fahd is majhul al-hal (his reliability is undocumented)
Transmission from al-Hasan uses 'an (عَنْ) which could indicate indirect transmission

potential_issues.issue: Chain is maqtu' - stops at al-Hasan al-Basri (Tabi'i level)
potential_issues.impact: This is not a marfu' hadith as it does not reach the Prophet ﷺ. It is a statement from a Tabi'i regarding Quranic interpretation.

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn al-Husayn (first narrator) is majhul (unknown)
potential_issues.impact: His reliability and trustworthiness cannot be established. This significantly affects the chain's authenticity.

potential_issues.issue: Ibrahim ibn Fahd is majhul al-hal - his reliability is undocumented
potential_issues.impact: Though multiple narrators report from him, his trustworthiness is not established. This weakens the chain considerably.

potential_issues.issue: Mubarak ibn Fadala is graded Thiqah Yukhti' (reliable but prone to errors)
potential_issues.impact: This narrator has documented issues with accuracy in some transmissions, though generally considered reliable by majority of scholars.

Topics: Quranic commentary on Surah Al-Furqan verse 65
Definition of al-Gharam (lasting punishment)
Explanation of Quranic terminology

hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'He will encounter hardship' (Surah Al-Furqan, verse 68), Mujahid said: 'It means a valley in Jahannam called Athaam.'

hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'And when they pass by frivolity, they pass by with dignity' (Surah Al-Furqan, verse 72), he said: 'When they are harmed, they pass by with dignity, meaning they overlook (the offense).'

hadiths.english_translation: They were six hundred thousand, there was among them none older than sixty years of age, nor any younger than twenty years of age. All of them perished in the wilderness except two: Yusha ibn Nun and Kaleb ibn Yupha.

hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'And they followed them at sunrise' (Surah Al-Shu'ara, verse 60), he said: Moses and his companions departed at night, and the moon was eclipsed that night, and the earth became dark. Moses' companions said: Verily, Joseph (ﷺ) informed us that we would be saved from Pharaoh, and he made a covenant with us that we would depart with his bones. So Moses went out that night searching for his grave, and found an old woman whose house was upon Joseph's grave. He asked her about it, and she informed him according to her will, and her will was that she said: Take me and bring me out with you. So Moses took Joseph's bones in his garment, then carried the old woman upon his garment, and carried him upon his neck, and departed with him. And Pharaoh's horses came galloping swiftly before his eyes, and did not cease being blocked from Moses and his companions until they vanished from sight.

hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'And I hope that my Lord will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment' (Surah Al-Shu'ara, verse 82), he said: It is his saying 'I am ill', and his saying 'Their chief among them did it', and his saying to Sarah 'She is my sister' when Pharaoh desired to take her.

chainIssues: Ibrahim ibn Fahd is majhul al-hal

Topics: Quranic commentary
Meaning of being bewitched

hadiths.english_translation: Abu al-Tufail said: Thamud said to the prophet of Allah Salih: 'Bring us a sign if you are truthful.' So Salih said to them: 'Go out.' So he brought them to a high place on the earth, and behold, it was laboring as a pregnant woman labors. Then it burst forth, and the she-camel came out from its midst. Then Salih said to them: 'This is a she-camel for her is a drink, and for you is a drink on a known day.' And: 'Do not touch her with harm lest the punishment of a great day seize you.' He said: So when they disliked her, they hamstrung her. Abdul-Aziz ibn Rufai' said: So a man told me saying: Salih said to them: The sign of the punishment is that they will awake the next day green, the second day yellow, and the third day black.

hadiths.english_translation: In the interpretation of the verse 'And you leave what your Lord has created for you from your wives?' (Surah Al-Shu'ara, verse 166), he said: You abandoned the vaginas of women for the posteriors of men and the posteriors of women.
